when_to_say: When referring to a building where people live.
example: Das ist mein Haus. (Das ist mine hows) - This is my house.

when_to_say: When referring to a male friend.
example: Er ist mein Freund. (Er ist mine froint) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of eating.
example: Ich esse Brot. (Ich eh-seh brot) - I eat bread.

when_to_say: When describing speed or quickness.
example: Der Zug ist schnell. (Der tsook ist shnell) - The train is fast.

when_to_say: When referring to a vehicle.
example: Das Auto ist rot. (Das ow-toh ist roht) - The car is red.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of reading.
example: Ich lese ein Buch. (Ich lay-zeh ain book) - I am reading a book.

when_to_say: When describing something visually pleasing.
example: Der Park ist schön. (Der park ist shurn) - The park is beautiful.

when_to_say: When referring to walking or running.
example: Ich laufe im Park. (Ich low-feh im park) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: When referring to the liquid we drink.
example: Ich trinke Wasser. (Ich trin-keh vah-ser) - I drink water.

when_to_say: When referring to resting or sleeping.
example: Ich schlafe gern. (Ich shlah-feh gairn) - I like to sleep.

when_to_say: When referring to the process of acquiring knowledge.
example: Ich lerne Deutsch. (Ich ler-neh doich) - I am learning German.

when_to_say: When referring to the process of thinking or reflecting.
example: Ich denke an dich. (Ich denk-eh an deesh) - I am thinking about you.

when_to_say: When referring to an educational institution.
example: Die Schule beginnt um 8 Uhr. (Dee shoo-leh beh-ginnt oom acht ooh-er) - School starts at 8 o'clock.

when_to_say: When referring to the fruit.
example: Der Apfel ist rot. (Der ap-fel ist roht) - The apple is red.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of writing.
example: Ich schreibe einen Brief. (Ich shry-beh ay-nen breef) - I am writing a letter.

when_to_say: When describing a state of joy or happiness.
example: Ich bin glücklich. (Ich bin glück-likh) - I am happy.

when_to_say: When referring to a book.
example: Das Buch ist interessant. (Das boo-kh ist int-er-es-sant) - The book is interesting.

when_to_say: When referring to the beverage.
example: Ich trinke Kaffee. (Ich trin-keh ka-fay) - I drink coffee.

when_to_say: When referring to playing games or activities.
example: Wir spielen Fußball. (Veer shpee-len foos-ball) - We play football.

when_to_say: When referring to the time period from sunrise to sunset.
example: Guten Tag! (Goo-ten tahg) - Good day!

when_to_say: When describing temperature or heat.
example: Das Wetter ist heiß. (Das vet-ter ist hice) - The weather is hot.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of running.
example: Er läuft sehr schnell. (Er lowft zair shnell) - He runs very fast.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of singing.
example: Ich singe ein Lied. (Ich zing-eh ain leed) - I am singing a song.

when_to_say: When referring to an entrance or exit.
example: Die Tür ist offen. (Dee tyr ist off-en) - The door is open.

when_to_say: When referring to acquiring new knowledge.
example: Wir lernen zusammen. (Veer ler-nen tsu-zam-en) - We are learning together.

when_to_say: When describing size or magnitude.
example: Das Haus ist groß. (Das hows ist gros) - The house is big.

when_to_say: When describing something small in size.
example: Der Hund ist klein. (Der hoond ist kline) - The dog is small.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of moving from one place to another.
example: Ich gehe nach Hause. (Ich gay-eh nahkh how-zeh) - I am going home.

when_to_say: When referring to the food item.
example: Ich esse Brot. (Ich eh-seh brot) - I eat bread.

when_to_say: When describing strength.
example: Er ist stark. (Er ist shtark) - He is strong.

when_to_say: When referring to the sky or heavens.
example: Der Himmel ist blau. (Der him-el ist blau) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: When describing physical movement.
example: Wir laufen im Park. (Veer low-fen im park) - We walk in the park.

when_to_say: When describing the color red.
example: Der Apfel ist rot. (Der ap-fel ist roht) - The apple is red.

when_to_say: When describing swimming activity.
example: Ich schwimme im See. (Ich shvim-meh im zay) - I swim in the lake.

when_to_say: When describing someone's behavior or attitude.
example: Sie ist sehr freundlich. (Zee ist zair froind-likh) - She is very friendly.

when_to_say: When describing age or something old.
example: Das Buch ist alt. (Das boo-kh ist ahlt) - The book is old.

when_to_say: When describing someone young.
example: Das Kind ist jung. (Das kint ist yoong) - The child is young.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of sitting.
example: Wir sitzen am Tisch. (Veer zit-zen am tish) - We sit at the table.

when_to_say: When describing the act of perceiving with the eyes.
example: Ich sehe den Hund. (Ich zay-eh den hoond) - I see the dog.

when_to_say: When referring to holding or moving something.
example: Ich trage die Tasche. (Ich trah-geh dee tah-sheh) - I carry the bag.

when_to_say: When describing the color blue.
example: Der Himmel ist blau. (Der him-el ist blow) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: When describing the color white.
example: Das Papier ist weiß. (Das pa-pee-er ist vice) - The paper is white.

when_to_say: When describing purchasing something.
example: Ich kaufe Obst. (Ich kow-feh obst) - I buy fruits.

when_to_say: When describing traveling in a vehicle.
example: Er fährt ein Auto. (Er fehrt ain ow-toh) - He drives a car.

when_to_say: When referring to the number 100.
example: Ich habe hundert Euro. (Ich hah-beh hoon-dert oi-roh) - I have 100 Euros.

when_to_say: When negating or refusing something.
example: Nein, danke. (Nine, dahn-keh) - No, thank you.

when_to_say: When politely requesting something.
example: Ein Kaffee, bitte. (Ain ka-fay, bit-teh) - A coffee, please.

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude.
example: Danke für die Hilfe! (Dahn-keh für dee hil-feh) - Thank you for the help!

when_to_say: When describing professional or physical labor.
example: Ich arbeite in einem Büro. (Ich ar-bite-eh in ain-em byu-roh) - I work in an office.

when_to_say: When referring to walking as a physical action.
example: Ich laufe nach Hause. (Ich low-feh nahkh how-zeh) - I walk home.

when_to_say: When describing something as positive or of high quality.
example: Das Essen ist gut. (Das ess-en ist goot) - The food is good.

when_to_say: When referring to a writing utensil.
example: Ich brauche einen Bleistift. (Ich brow-keh eye-nen blye-shtift) - I need a pencil.

when_to_say: When referring to a window in a building.
example: Das Fenster ist offen. (Das fen-ster ist off-en) - The window is open.

when_to_say: When describing someone as caring or kind.
example: Du bist so lieb! (Doo bist zoh leeb) - You are so kind!

when_to_say: When referring to writing with a pen or pencil.
example: Ich schreibe einen Brief. (Ich shry-beh eye-nen breef) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: When describing the act of eating.
example: Wir essen Abendessen. (Veer es-sen ah-bent-es-sen) - We eat dinner.

when_to_say: When referring to consuming liquids.
example: Ich trinke Wasser. (Ich trink-eh vah-ser) - I drink water.

when_to_say: When talking about happiness or wishing good fortune.
example: Viel Glück! (Feel glük) - Good luck!

when_to_say: When referring to the process of thinking.
example: Ich denke an dich. (Ich denk-eh an dish) - I think of you.

when_to_say: When referring to playing games or instruments.
example: Wir spielen Fußball. (Veer shpeel-en foos-ball) - We play soccer.

when_to_say: When referring to a male friend.
example: Er ist mein Freund. (Er ist mine froind) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: When referring to a female friend.
example: Sie ist meine Freundin. (Zee ist mine-eh froin-din) - She is my friend.

when_to_say: When describing something as recently made or discovered.
example: Das ist ein neues Auto. (Das ist ain noy-es ow-toh) - That is a new car.

when_to_say: When describing something outdated.
example: Das Kleid ist altmodisch. (Das klide ist ahlt-mo-dish) - The dress is old-fashioned.

when_to_say: When referring to living in a place.
example: Ich wohne in Berlin. (Ich voh-neh in ber-leen) - I live in Berlin.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of seeing something.
example: Ich sehe einen Vogel. (Ich zay-eh eye-nen voh-gel) - I see a bird.

when_to_say: When referring to speaking a language or communicating.
example: Ich spreche Deutsch. (Ich shprekh-eh doytch) - I speak German.

when_to_say: When referring to perceiving sound.
example: Ich höre Musik. (Ich hoor-eh moo-zeek) - I hear music.

when_to_say: When referring to your mother.
example: Meine Mutter ist zu Hause. (Mine-eh moo-ter ist tsu how-zeh) - My mother is at home.

when_to_say: When referring to your father.
example: Mein Vater arbeitet viel. (Mine fah-ter ar-bite-et feel) - My father works a lot.

when_to_say: When referring to a young person.
example: Das Kind spielt im Garten. (Das kint shpeelt im gar-ten) - The child plays in the garden.

when_to_say: When referring to acquiring knowledge or skills.
example: Ich lerne Deutsch. (Ich ler-neh doytch) - I am learning German.

when_to_say: When describing air travel or a bird in flight.
example: Der Vogel fliegt. (Der fo-gel fleegt) - The bird is flying.

when_to_say: When referring to reading a book or text.
example: Ich lese ein Buch. (Ich lay-zeh ein book) - I am reading a book.

when_to_say: When describing running as an action.
example: Ich laufe jeden Morgen. (Ich low-feh yay-den mor-gen) - I run every morning.

when_to_say: When referring to an automobile.
example: Das Auto ist rot. (Das ow-toh ist roht) - The car is red.

when_to_say: When referring to a building where people live.
example: Das Haus ist groß. (Das hows ist grohs) - The house is big.

when_to_say: When referring to an educational institution.
example: Die Schule beginnt um acht Uhr. (Dee shoo-leh beh-gint oom ahkt oor) - The school starts at 8 o'clock.

when_to_say: When referring to a male educator.
example: Der Lehrer ist nett. (Der lay-rehr ist net) - The teacher is kind.

when_to_say: When referring to a domesticated feline.
example: Die Katze schläft. (Dee kaht-zeh shlayft) - The cat is sleeping.

when_to_say: When referring to a domesticated canine.
example: Der Hund spielt im Garten. (Der hoond shpeelt im gar-ten) - The dog is playing in the garden.

when_to_say: When referring to a printed or digital literary work.
example: Das Buch ist interessant. (Das bookh ist in-teh-res-sant) - The book is interesting.

when_to_say: When referring to the liquid essential for life.
example: Ich trinke Wasser. (Ich trink-eh vah-ser) - I drink water.

when_to_say: When referring to the period of daylight.
example: Heute ist ein schöner Tag. (Hoy-teh ist ein shuh-ner tahg) - Today is a beautiful day.

when_to_say: When referring to an urban area.
example: Die Stadt ist groß. (Dee shtaht ist grohs) - The city is big.

when_to_say: When expressing happiness or delight.
example: Es macht mir Freude. (Es mahkht meer froy-deh) - It brings me joy.

when_to_say: When referring to the ability to wait calmly.
example: Geduld ist eine Tugend. (Geh-doolt ist eye-neh too-gent) - Patience is a virtue.

when_to_say: When referring to a mode of transport on rails.
example: Der Zug ist pünktlich. (Der tsoog ist poonk-tlich) - The train is on time.

when_to_say: When referring to a medical professional.
example: Der Arzt untersucht den Patienten. (Der ahrtst oon-ter-zookht den pah-tee-en-ten) - The doctor examines the patient.

when_to_say: When referring to a place for swimming.
example: Das Schwimmbad ist geöffnet. (Das shvim-bahd ist geh-oef-net) - The swimming pool is open.

when_to_say: When referring to the first meal of the day.
example: Ich esse Frühstück um acht Uhr. (Ich es-seh froo-shtük oom ahkt oor) - I eat breakfast at 8 o'clock.

when_to_say: When referring to an object for opening locks.
example: Wo ist mein Schlüssel? (Voh ist mine shlü-sel) - Where is my key?

when_to_say: When referring to a printed news publication.
example: Die Zeitung liegt auf dem Tisch. (Dee tsai-toong leegt owf dem tish) - The newspaper is on the table.

when_to_say: When referring to a tall plant with a trunk and branches.
example: Der Baum ist grün. (Der bawm ist groon) - The tree is green.

when_to_say: When referring to a public road.
example: Die Straße ist breit. (Dee shtrah-seh ist bright) - The street is wide.

when_to_say: When referring to luggage for travel.
example: Ich packe meinen Koffer. (Ich pak-keh mine-en kof-er) - I pack my suitcase.

when_to_say: When referring to a place where planes land and take off.
example: Der Flughafen ist weit entfernt. (Der flookh-hah-fen ist vite ent-fernt) - The airport is far away.

when_to_say: When referring to a staple food made from flour and water.
example: Ich esse Brot mit Butter. (Ich es-seh broht mit boo-ter) - I eat bread with butter.

when_to_say: When referring to an item used to protect from rain.
example: Ich nehme meinen Regenschirm mit. (Ich neh-meh mine-en ray-gen-shirm mit) - I take my umbrella with me.

when_to_say: When referring to a colorful plant bloom.
example: Die Blume ist schön. (Dee bloo-meh ist shern) - The flower is beautiful.
